title: Entangling gates using Josephson circuits coupled through non-classical microwaves.
abstract: NoA system consisting of two Josephson qubits coupled through a quantum monochromatic electromagnetic field mode of a resonant tank circuit is studied. It is shown that for certain values of the parameters, it can be used as an entangling gate, which entangles the two qubits whilst the electromagnetic field remains disentangled. The gate operates with decent fidelity to a  gate and could form the basis for initial experimental investigations of coupled superconducting qubits

Superconducting Quantum Interference Devices (SQUIDs)</dc:subject><dc:description>
No</dc:description><dc:description>
A system consisting of two Josephson qubits coupled through a quantum monochromatic electromagnetic field mode of a resonant tank circuit is studied. It is shown that for certain values of the parameters, it can be used as an entangling gate, which entangles the two qubits whilst the electromagnetic field remains disentangled. The gate operates with decent fidelity to a  gate and could form the basis for initial experimental investigations of coupled superconducting qubits.</dc:description><dc:date>
